ACT
126
Unworthiness to inherit
Unworthiness does not affect the descendants of the unworthy and they inherit as if he had died before the testator.
The unworthiness ends with the testator's forgiveness given in the form prescribed for the validity of the will.
Unworthiness is taken care of ex officio, except in the case of the offense of maintenance obligation, failure to provide necessary assistance and leaving the testator without assistance in situations that are dangerous to life or health.
